intro: Curcas drastica, commonly known as the Chinese tallow tree, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and opposite, simple, ovate leaves that turn yellow in the fall. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into orange to red berries, each containing several seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been introduced to other parts of the world, sometimes becoming invasive. The tree is also valued for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and climates.
